text: thanks guys, that really helped me :slightly_smiling_face: I did managed to make it

Hey, I’m pretty new to HubDB (and HubSpot overall) and I’m having a hard time figuring out how to filter a row only if it has a value inputted in it? I wrote some code to style as a button if it has a value, but I don’t want to button to show up if there isn’t anything in that row in HubDB. Help?
wrap it in an if statement
<@UD53A9UUR> I did wrap it in an if statement, but I’m unsure on what to put in that if statement to make it filter. Sorry, I should have been more clear on that.
can you put a snippet up to look at?
that worked, sorry I must have not been writing it properly. thank you!

would be nice if the date picker field it was made easier to set a year. currently you have to page through all 12 months in the year to get to the previous year. doing it for multiple years is a royal pain
Yeah. there are plenty of options for date pickers out there that have that function

I know you can normally clikc on the year or month and it will show a dropdown, but when choosing values for date picker contact properties, you have to do a lot of clicking since HubSpot removes that dropdown feature
honestly if they just used the native date input I’d be completely fine with that
